channel.title: Chemtrails
channel.description:
Chemtrails are the white lines left by airplanes, that if you watch for a while, eventually grow bigger and bigger. Every few days, a bunch of them appear, then after a couple hours, the whole sky is filled with haze. At the same time, other airplanes are passing through, but all they leave is just a small white line that disappears quickly. The government says that it is just water vapor, but some people say it is weather control or chemicals that the government is trying to spray. I don't think it's water vapor or just gas, but I also think the things about weather control and chemicals is bullshit. What do you think?
Pictures off google: [img]http://www.samliquidation.com/images/CHEM1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://www.relfe.com/Images/chemtrail%20contrail%20croppedl.jpg[/img] The small white line is just a normal exhaust/water vapor (contrail).

item.title: Chemtrails
item.dc:creator: @lordbost lordbost
item.description:
@lordbost wrote:

Proponents of the chemtrail theories differentiate chemtrails from contrails by describing them as streams that sometimes persist in the sky for hours, and which sometimes trace criss-crossing, grid-like patterns, or parallel stripes which eventually blend to form large clouds. Another feature that proponents say distinguishes a chemtrail from a contrail is the presence of visible color prisms in the streams, unusual concentrations of sky tracks in a single area, or lingering tracks left by unmarked or military airplanes flying in atypical altitudes or locations.[1][2][3][9]
Patrick Minnis, an atmospheric scientist with NASA's Langley Research Center in Hampton, Virginia, is quoted in USA Today as saying that logic is not exactly a real selling point for most chemtrail proponents. "If you try to pin these people down and refute things, it's, 'Well, you're just part of the conspiracy'", he said. [1]

Personally i do not believe this bullshit.

EDIT: http://www.alternet.org/environment/122849/chemtrails_in_the_sky_are_evidence_of_nefarious_activities_for_broad-based_conspiracy_theorists?page=entire

Read full topic

item.title: Chemtrails
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

My Grandfather always said that they seeded the clouds, although he was probably an eccentric. I have to say it could very well be true. I kind of believe it, but that doesn’t rock my world or anything. I wouldn’t be surprised or astounded if the government came out and admitted it. There are plenty of secret things the American Government does. They have hundreds of buildings around the world that ‘don’t exist’.

Read full topic

item.title: Chemtrails
item.dc:creator: @stormcutter stormcutter
item.description:
@stormcutter wrote:

[quote=“Attiusca, post:4, topic:258081”]Uhm, clouds?

-Attiusca[/quote]

No, on a clear day look at one of them come by, then it keeps expanding and expanding until the whole sky is covered. Also, the lines appear in a grid like system, and when one comes, it is shortly followed by another.

I personally don’t think it’s anything harmful, and don’t believe any of it, but it’s just something that makes you wonder.

Read full topic
